main event: Round objects of bluish-green color observed climbing for 6 minutes on March 24, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were observed by multiple reliable military personnel including tower operators and airmen., The sighting involved a ground-radar source., The conclusion suggested they could be a weather balloon due to appearance, course, and speed., The observation lasted for a total of 6 minutes., The specific colors and descriptions of the objects were noted in the report.
witness description: tower operators and airmen from the 796 ACMW SQ, considered very reliable
